30#include <sys/cdefs.h>
31__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: radeon_vm.c,v 1.6 2018/08/27 07:52:32 riastradh Exp $");
32
33#include <drm/drmP.h>
34#include <drm/radeon_drm.h>
35#include "radeon.h"
36#include "radeon_trace.h"
37
38/*
39 * GPUVM
40 * GPUVM is similar to the legacy gart on older asics, however
41 * rather than there being a single global gart table
42 * for the entire GPU, there are multiple VM page tables active
43 * at any given time. The VM page tables can contain a mix
44 * vram pages and system memory pages and system memory pages
45 * can be mapped as snooped (cached system pages) or unsnooped
46 * (uncached system pages).
47 * Each VM has an ID associated with it and there is a page table
48 * associated with each VMID. When execting a command buffer,
49 * the kernel tells the the ring what VMID to use for that command
50 * buffer. VMIDs are allocated dynamically as commands are submitted.
51 * The userspace drivers maintain their own address space and the kernel
52 * sets up their pages tables accordingly when they submit their
53 * command buffers and a VMID is assigned.
54 * Cayman/Trinity support up to 8 active VMs at any given time;
55 * SI supports 16.
56 */
57
58/**
59 * radeon_vm_num_pde - return the number of page directory entries
60 *
61 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
62 *
63 * Calculate the number of page directory entries (cayman+).
64 */
65static unsigned radeon_vm_num_pdes(struct radeon_device *rdev)
66{
67 return rdev->vm_manager.max_pfn >> radeon_vm_block_size;
68}
69
70/**
71 * radeon_vm_directory_size - returns the size of the page directory in bytes
72 *
73 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
74 *
75 * Calculate the size of the page directory in bytes (cayman+).
76 */
77static unsigned radeon_vm_directory_size(struct radeon_device *rdev)
78{
79 return RADEON_GPU_PAGE_ALIGN(radeon_vm_num_pdes(rdev) * 8);
80}
81
82/**
83 * radeon_vm_manager_init - init the vm manager
84 *
85 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
86 *
87 * Init the vm manager (cayman+).
88 * Returns 0 for success, error for failure.
89 */
90int radeon_vm_manager_init(struct radeon_device *rdev)
91{
92 int r;
93
94 if (!rdev->vm_manager.enabled) {
95 r = radeon_asic_vm_init(rdev);
96 if (r)
97 return r;
98
99 rdev->vm_manager.enabled = true;
100 }
101 return 0;
102}
103
104/**
105 * radeon_vm_manager_fini - tear down the vm manager
106 *
107 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
108 *
109 * Tear down the VM manager (cayman+).
110 */
111void radeon_vm_manager_fini(struct radeon_device *rdev)
112{
113 int i;
114
115 if (!rdev->vm_manager.enabled)
116 return;
117
118 for (i = 0; i < RADEON_NUM_VM; ++i)
119 radeon_fence_unref(&rdev->vm_manager.active[i]);
120 radeon_asic_vm_fini(rdev);
121 rdev->vm_manager.enabled = false;
122}
123
124/**
125 * radeon_vm_get_bos - add the vm BOs to a validation list
126 *
127 * @vm: vm providing the BOs
128 * @head: head of validation list
129 *
130 * Add the page directory to the list of BOs to
131 * validate for command submission (cayman+).
132 */
133struct radeon_bo_list *radeon_vm_get_bos(struct radeon_device *rdev,
134 struct radeon_vm *vm,
135 struct list_head *head)
136{
137 struct radeon_bo_list *list;
138 unsigned i, idx;
139
140 list = drm_malloc_ab(vm->max_pde_used + 2,
141 sizeof(struct radeon_bo_list));
142 if (!list)
143 return NULL;
144
145 /* add the vm page table to the list */
146 list[0].robj = vm->page_directory;
147 list[0].prefered_domains = RADEON_GEM_DOMAIN_VRAM;
148 list[0].allowed_domains = RADEON_GEM_DOMAIN_VRAM;
149 list[0].tv.bo = &vm->page_directory->tbo;
150 list[0].tv.shared = true;
151 list[0].tiling_flags = 0;
152 list_add(&list[0].tv.head, head);
153
154 for (i = 0, idx = 1; i <= vm->max_pde_used; i++) {
155 if (!vm->page_tables[i].bo)
156 continue;
157
158 list[idx].robj = vm->page_tables[i].bo;
159 list[idx].prefered_domains = RADEON_GEM_DOMAIN_VRAM;
160 list[idx].allowed_domains = RADEON_GEM_DOMAIN_VRAM;
161 list[idx].tv.bo = &list[idx].robj->tbo;
162 list[idx].tv.shared = true;
163 list[idx].tiling_flags = 0;
164 list_add(&list[idx++].tv.head, head);
165 }
166
167 return list;
168}
169
170/**
171 * radeon_vm_grab_id - allocate the next free VMID
172 *
173 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
174 * @vm: vm to allocate id for
175 * @ring: ring we want to submit job to
176 *
177 * Allocate an id for the vm (cayman+).
178 * Returns the fence we need to sync to (if any).
179 *
180 * Global and local mutex must be locked!
181 */
182struct radeon_fence *radeon_vm_grab_id(struct radeon_device *rdev,
183 struct radeon_vm *vm, int ring)
184{
185 struct radeon_fence *best[RADEON_NUM_RINGS] = {};
186 struct radeon_vm_id *vm_id = &vm->ids[ring];
187
188 unsigned choices[2] = {};
189 unsigned i;
190
191 /* check if the id is still valid */
192 if (vm_id->id && vm_id->last_id_use &&
193 vm_id->last_id_use == rdev->vm_manager.active[vm_id->id])
194 return NULL;
195
196 /* we definately need to flush */
197 vm_id->pd_gpu_addr = ~0ll;
198
199 /* skip over VMID 0, since it is the system VM */
200 for (i = 1; i < rdev->vm_manager.nvm; ++i) {
201 struct radeon_fence *fence = rdev->vm_manager.active[i];
202
203 if (fence == NULL) {
204 /* found a free one */
205 vm_id->id = i;
206 trace_radeon_vm_grab_id(i, ring);
207 return NULL;
208 }
209
210 if (radeon_fence_is_earlier(fence, best[fence->ring])) {
211 best[fence->ring] = fence;
212 choices[fence->ring == ring ? 0 : 1] = i;
213 }
214 }
215
216 for (i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
217 if (choices[i]) {
218 vm_id->id = choices[i];
219 trace_radeon_vm_grab_id(choices[i], ring);
220 return rdev->vm_manager.active[choices[i]];
221 }
222 }
223
224 /* should never happen */
225 BUG();
226 return NULL;
227}
228
229/**
230 * radeon_vm_flush - hardware flush the vm
231 *
232 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
233 * @vm: vm we want to flush
234 * @ring: ring to use for flush
235 * @updates: last vm update that is waited for
236 *
237 * Flush the vm (cayman+).
238 *
239 * Global and local mutex must be locked!
240 */
241void radeon_vm_flush(struct radeon_device *rdev,
242 struct radeon_vm *vm,
243 int ring, struct radeon_fence *updates)
244{
245 uint64_t pd_addr = radeon_bo_gpu_offset(vm->page_directory);
246 struct radeon_vm_id *vm_id = &vm->ids[ring];
247
248 if (pd_addr != vm_id->pd_gpu_addr || !vm_id->flushed_updates ||
249 radeon_fence_is_earlier(vm_id->flushed_updates, updates)) {
250
251 trace_radeon_vm_flush(pd_addr, ring, vm->ids[ring].id);
252 radeon_fence_unref(&vm_id->flushed_updates);
253 vm_id->flushed_updates = radeon_fence_ref(updates);
254 vm_id->pd_gpu_addr = pd_addr;
255 radeon_ring_vm_flush(rdev, &rdev->ring[ring],
256 vm_id->id, vm_id->pd_gpu_addr);
257
258 }
259}
260
261/**
262 * radeon_vm_fence - remember fence for vm
263 *
264 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
265 * @vm: vm we want to fence
266 * @fence: fence to remember
267 *
268 * Fence the vm (cayman+).
269 * Set the fence used to protect page table and id.
270 *
271 * Global and local mutex must be locked!
272 */
273void radeon_vm_fence(struct radeon_device *rdev,
274 struct radeon_vm *vm,
275 struct radeon_fence *fence)
276{
277 unsigned vm_id = vm->ids[fence->ring].id;
278
279 radeon_fence_unref(&rdev->vm_manager.active[vm_id]);
280 rdev->vm_manager.active[vm_id] = radeon_fence_ref(fence);
281
282 radeon_fence_unref(&vm->ids[fence->ring].last_id_use);
283 vm->ids[fence->ring].last_id_use = radeon_fence_ref(fence);
284}
285
286/**
287 * radeon_vm_bo_find - find the bo_va for a specific vm & bo
288 *
289 * @vm: requested vm
290 * @bo: requested buffer object
291 *
292 * Find @bo inside the requested vm (cayman+).
293 * Search inside the @bos vm list for the requested vm
294 * Returns the found bo_va or NULL if none is found
295 *
296 * Object has to be reserved!
297 */
298struct radeon_bo_va *radeon_vm_bo_find(struct radeon_vm *vm,
299 struct radeon_bo *bo)
300{
301 struct radeon_bo_va *bo_va;
302
303 list_for_each_entry(bo_va, &bo->va, bo_list) {
304 if (bo_va->vm == vm) {
305 return bo_va;
306 }
307 }
308 return NULL;
309}
310
311/**
312 * radeon_vm_bo_add - add a bo to a specific vm
313 *
314 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
315 * @vm: requested vm
316 * @bo: radeon buffer object
317 *
318 * Add @bo into the requested vm (cayman+).
319 * Add @bo to the list of bos associated with the vm
320 * Returns newly added bo_va or NULL for failure
321 *
322 * Object has to be reserved!
323 */
324struct radeon_bo_va *radeon_vm_bo_add(struct radeon_device *rdev,
325 struct radeon_vm *vm,
326 struct radeon_bo *bo)
327{
328 struct radeon_bo_va *bo_va;
329
330 bo_va = kzalloc(sizeof(struct radeon_bo_va), GFP_KERNEL);
331 if (bo_va == NULL) {
332 return NULL;
333 }
334 bo_va->vm = vm;
335 bo_va->bo = bo;
336 bo_va->it.start = 0;
337 bo_va->it.last = 0;
338 bo_va->flags = 0;
339 bo_va->ref_count = 1;
340 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&bo_va->bo_list);
341 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&bo_va->vm_status);
342
343 mutex_lock(&vm->mutex);
344 list_add_tail(&bo_va->bo_list, &bo->va);
345 mutex_unlock(&vm->mutex);
346
347 return bo_va;
348}
349
350/**
351 * radeon_vm_set_pages - helper to call the right asic function
352 *
353 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
354 * @ib: indirect buffer to fill with commands
355 * @pe: addr of the page entry
356 * @addr: dst addr to write into pe
357 * @count: number of page entries to update
358 * @incr: increase next addr by incr bytes
359 * @flags: hw access flags
360 *
361 * Traces the parameters and calls the right asic functions
362 * to setup the page table using the DMA.
363 */
364static void radeon_vm_set_pages(struct radeon_device *rdev,
365 struct radeon_ib *ib,
366 uint64_t pe,
367 uint64_t addr, unsigned count,
368 uint32_t incr, uint32_t flags)
369{
370 trace_radeon_vm_set_page(pe, addr, count, incr, flags);
371
372 if ((flags & R600_PTE_GART_MASK) == R600_PTE_GART_MASK) {
373 uint64_t src = rdev->gart.table_addr + (addr >> 12) * 8;
374 radeon_asic_vm_copy_pages(rdev, ib, pe, src, count);
375
376 } else if ((flags & R600_PTE_SYSTEM) || (count < 3)) {
377 radeon_asic_vm_write_pages(rdev, ib, pe, addr,
378 count, incr, flags);
379
380 } else {
381 radeon_asic_vm_set_pages(rdev, ib, pe, addr,
382 count, incr, flags);
383 }
384}
385
386/**
387 * radeon_vm_clear_bo - initially clear the page dir/table
388 *
389 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
390 * @bo: bo to clear
391 */
392static int radeon_vm_clear_bo(struct radeon_device *rdev,
393 struct radeon_bo *bo)
394{
395 struct radeon_ib ib;
396 unsigned entries;
397 uint64_t addr;
398 int r;
399
400 r = radeon_bo_reserve(bo, false);
401 if (r)
402 return r;
403
404 r = ttm_bo_validate(&bo->tbo, &bo->placement, true, false);
405 if (r)
406 goto error_unreserve;
407
408 addr = radeon_bo_gpu_offset(bo);
409 entries = radeon_bo_size(bo) / 8;
410
411 r = radeon_ib_get(rdev, R600_RING_TYPE_DMA_INDEX, &ib, NULL, 256);
412 if (r)
413 goto error_unreserve;
414
415 ib.length_dw = 0;
416
417 radeon_vm_set_pages(rdev, &ib, addr, 0, entries, 0, 0);
418 radeon_asic_vm_pad_ib(rdev, &ib);
419 WARN_ON(ib.length_dw > 64);
420
421 r = radeon_ib_schedule(rdev, &ib, NULL, false);
422 if (r)
423 goto error_free;
424
425 ib.fence->is_vm_update = true;
426 radeon_bo_fence(bo, ib.fence, false);
427
428error_free:
429 radeon_ib_free(rdev, &ib);
430
431error_unreserve:
432 radeon_bo_unreserve(bo);
433 return r;
434}
435
436/**
437 * radeon_vm_bo_set_addr - set bos virtual address inside a vm
438 *
439 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
440 * @bo_va: bo_va to store the address
441 * @soffset: requested offset of the buffer in the VM address space
442 * @flags: attributes of pages (read/write/valid/etc.)
443 *
444 * Set offset of @bo_va (cayman+).
445 * Validate and set the offset requested within the vm address space.
446 * Returns 0 for success, error for failure.
447 *
448 * Object has to be reserved and gets unreserved by this function!
449 */
450int radeon_vm_bo_set_addr(struct radeon_device *rdev,
451 struct radeon_bo_va *bo_va,
452 uint64_t soffset,
453 uint32_t flags)
454{
455 uint64_t size = radeon_bo_size(bo_va->bo);
456 struct radeon_vm *vm = bo_va->vm;
457 unsigned last_pfn, pt_idx;
458 uint64_t eoffset;
459 int r;
460
461 if (soffset) {
462 /* make sure object fit at this offset */
463 eoffset = soffset + size - 1;
464 if (soffset >= eoffset) {
465 r = -EINVAL;
466 goto error_unreserve;
467 }
468
469 last_pfn = eoffset / RADEON_GPU_PAGE_SIZE;
470 if (last_pfn >= rdev->vm_manager.max_pfn) {
471 dev_err(rdev->dev, "va above limit (0x%08X >= 0x%08X)\n",
472 last_pfn, rdev->vm_manager.max_pfn);
473 r = -EINVAL;
474 goto error_unreserve;
475 }
476
477 } else {
478 eoffset = last_pfn = 0;
479 }
480
481 mutex_lock(&vm->mutex);
482 soffset /= RADEON_GPU_PAGE_SIZE;
483 eoffset /= RADEON_GPU_PAGE_SIZE;
484 if (soffset || eoffset) {
485 struct interval_tree_node *it;
486 it = interval_tree_iter_first(&vm->va, soffset, eoffset);
487 if (it && it != &bo_va->it) {
488 struct radeon_bo_va *tmp;
489 tmp = container_of(it, struct radeon_bo_va, it);
490 /* bo and tmp overlap, invalid offset */
491 dev_err(rdev->dev, "bo %p va 0x%010"PRIx64" conflict with "
492 "(bo %p 0x%010lx 0x%010lx)\n", bo_va->bo,
493 soffset, tmp->bo, tmp->it.start, tmp->it.last);
494 mutex_unlock(&vm->mutex);
495 r = -EINVAL;
496 goto error_unreserve;
497 }
498 }
499
500 if (bo_va->it.start || bo_va->it.last) {
501 /* add a clone of the bo_va to clear the old address */
502 struct radeon_bo_va *tmp;
503 tmp = kzalloc(sizeof(struct radeon_bo_va), GFP_KERNEL);
504 if (!tmp) {
505 mutex_unlock(&vm->mutex);
506 r = -ENOMEM;
507 goto error_unreserve;
508 }
509 tmp->it.start = bo_va->it.start;
510 tmp->it.last = bo_va->it.last;
511 tmp->vm = vm;
512 tmp->bo = radeon_bo_ref(bo_va->bo);
513
514 interval_tree_remove(&bo_va->it, &vm->va);
515 spin_lock(&vm->status_lock);
516 bo_va->it.start = 0;
517 bo_va->it.last = 0;
518 list_del_init(&bo_va->vm_status);
519 list_add(&tmp->vm_status, &vm->freed);
520 spin_unlock(&vm->status_lock);
521 }
522
523 if (soffset || eoffset) {
524 spin_lock(&vm->status_lock);
525 bo_va->it.start = soffset;
526 bo_va->it.last = eoffset;
527 list_add(&bo_va->vm_status, &vm->cleared);
528 spin_unlock(&vm->status_lock);
529 interval_tree_insert(&bo_va->it, &vm->va);
530 }
531
532 bo_va->flags = flags;
533
534 soffset >>= radeon_vm_block_size;
535 eoffset >>= radeon_vm_block_size;
536
537 BUG_ON(eoffset >= radeon_vm_num_pdes(rdev));
538
539 if (eoffset > vm->max_pde_used)
540 vm->max_pde_used = eoffset;
541
542 radeon_bo_unreserve(bo_va->bo);
543
544 /* walk over the address space and allocate the page tables */
545 for (pt_idx = soffset; pt_idx <= eoffset; ++pt_idx) {
546 struct radeon_bo *pt;
547
548 if (vm->page_tables[pt_idx].bo)
549 continue;
550
551 /* drop mutex to allocate and clear page table */
552 mutex_unlock(&vm->mutex);
553
554 r = radeon_bo_create(rdev, RADEON_VM_PTE_COUNT * 8,
555 RADEON_GPU_PAGE_SIZE, true,
556 RADEON_GEM_DOMAIN_VRAM, 0,
557 NULL, NULL, &pt);
558 if (r)
559 return r;
560
561 r = radeon_vm_clear_bo(rdev, pt);
562 if (r) {
563 radeon_bo_unref(&pt);
564 return r;
565 }
566
567 /* aquire mutex again */
568 mutex_lock(&vm->mutex);
569 if (vm->page_tables[pt_idx].bo) {
570 /* someone else allocated the pt in the meantime */
571 mutex_unlock(&vm->mutex);
572 radeon_bo_unref(&pt);
573 mutex_lock(&vm->mutex);
574 continue;
575 }
576
577 vm->page_tables[pt_idx].addr = 0;
578 vm->page_tables[pt_idx].bo = pt;
579 }
580
581 mutex_unlock(&vm->mutex);
582 return 0;
583
584error_unreserve:
585 radeon_bo_unreserve(bo_va->bo);
586 return r;
587}
588
589/**
590 * radeon_vm_map_gart - get the physical address of a gart page
591 *
592 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
593 * @addr: the unmapped addr
594 *
595 * Look up the physical address of the page that the pte resolves
596 * to (cayman+).
597 * Returns the physical address of the page.
598 */
599uint64_t radeon_vm_map_gart(struct radeon_device *rdev, uint64_t addr)
600{
601 uint64_t result;
602
603 /* page table offset */
604 result = rdev->gart.pages_entry[addr >> RADEON_GPU_PAGE_SHIFT];
605 result &= ~RADEON_GPU_PAGE_MASK;
606
607 return result;
608}
609
610/**
611 * radeon_vm_page_flags - translate page flags to what the hw uses
612 *
613 * @flags: flags comming from userspace
614 *
615 * Translate the flags the userspace ABI uses to hw flags.
616 */
617static uint32_t radeon_vm_page_flags(uint32_t flags)
618{
619 uint32_t hw_flags = 0;
620 hw_flags |= (flags & RADEON_VM_PAGE_VALID) ? R600_PTE_VALID : 0;
621 hw_flags |= (flags & RADEON_VM_PAGE_READABLE) ? R600_PTE_READABLE : 0;
622 hw_flags |= (flags & RADEON_VM_PAGE_WRITEABLE) ? R600_PTE_WRITEABLE : 0;
623 if (flags & RADEON_VM_PAGE_SYSTEM) {
624 hw_flags |= R600_PTE_SYSTEM;
625 hw_flags |= (flags & RADEON_VM_PAGE_SNOOPED) ? R600_PTE_SNOOPED : 0;
626 }
627 return hw_flags;
628}
629
630/**
631 * radeon_vm_update_pdes - make sure that page directory is valid
632 *
633 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
634 * @vm: requested vm
635 * @start: start of GPU address range
636 * @end: end of GPU address range
637 *
638 * Allocates new page tables if necessary
639 * and updates the page directory (cayman+).
640 * Returns 0 for success, error for failure.
641 *
642 * Global and local mutex must be locked!
643 */
644int radeon_vm_update_page_directory(struct radeon_device *rdev,
645 struct radeon_vm *vm)
646{
647 struct radeon_bo *pd = vm->page_directory;
648 uint64_t pd_addr = radeon_bo_gpu_offset(pd);
649 uint32_t incr = RADEON_VM_PTE_COUNT * 8;
650 uint64_t last_pde = ~0, last_pt = ~0;
651 unsigned count = 0, pt_idx, ndw;
652 struct radeon_ib ib;
653 int r;
654
655 /* padding, etc. */
656 ndw = 64;
657
658 /* assume the worst case */
659 ndw += vm->max_pde_used * 6;
660
661 /* update too big for an IB */
662 if (ndw > 0xfffff)
663 return -ENOMEM;
664
665 r = radeon_ib_get(rdev, R600_RING_TYPE_DMA_INDEX, &ib, NULL, ndw * 4);
666 if (r)
667 return r;
668 ib.length_dw = 0;
669
670 /* walk over the address space and update the page directory */
671 for (pt_idx = 0; pt_idx <= vm->max_pde_used; ++pt_idx) {
672 struct radeon_bo *bo = vm->page_tables[pt_idx].bo;
673 uint64_t pde, pt;
674
675 if (bo == NULL)
676 continue;
677
678 pt = radeon_bo_gpu_offset(bo);
679 if (vm->page_tables[pt_idx].addr == pt)
680 continue;
681 vm->page_tables[pt_idx].addr = pt;
682
683 pde = pd_addr + pt_idx * 8;
684 if (((last_pde + 8 * count) != pde) ||
685 ((last_pt + incr * count) != pt)) {
686
687 if (count) {
688 radeon_vm_set_pages(rdev, &ib, last_pde,
689 last_pt, count, incr,
690 R600_PTE_VALID);
691 }
692
693 count = 1;
694 last_pde = pde;
695 last_pt = pt;
696 } else {
697 ++count;
698 }
699 }
700
701 if (count)
702 radeon_vm_set_pages(rdev, &ib, last_pde, last_pt, count,
703 incr, R600_PTE_VALID);
704
705 if (ib.length_dw != 0) {
706 radeon_asic_vm_pad_ib(rdev, &ib);
707
708 radeon_sync_resv(rdev, &ib.sync, pd->tbo.resv, true);
709 WARN_ON(ib.length_dw > ndw);
710 r = radeon_ib_schedule(rdev, &ib, NULL, false);
711 if (r) {
712 radeon_ib_free(rdev, &ib);
713 return r;
714 }
715 ib.fence->is_vm_update = true;
716 radeon_bo_fence(pd, ib.fence, false);
717 }
718 radeon_ib_free(rdev, &ib);
719
720 return 0;
721}
722
723/**
724 * radeon_vm_frag_ptes - add fragment information to PTEs
725 *
726 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
727 * @ib: IB for the update
728 * @pe_start: first PTE to handle
729 * @pe_end: last PTE to handle
730 * @addr: addr those PTEs should point to
731 * @flags: hw mapping flags
732 *
733 * Global and local mutex must be locked!
734 */
735static void radeon_vm_frag_ptes(struct radeon_device *rdev,
736 struct radeon_ib *ib,
737 uint64_t pe_start, uint64_t pe_end,
738 uint64_t addr, uint32_t flags)
739{
740 /**
741 * The MC L1 TLB supports variable sized pages, based on a fragment
742 * field in the PTE. When this field is set to a non-zero value, page
743 * granularity is increased from 4KB to (1 << (12 + frag)). The PTE
744 * flags are considered valid for all PTEs within the fragment range
745 * and corresponding mappings are assumed to be physically contiguous.
746 *
747 * The L1 TLB can store a single PTE for the whole fragment,
748 * significantly increasing the space available for translation
749 * caching. This leads to large improvements in throughput when the
750 * TLB is under pressure.
751 *
752 * The L2 TLB distributes small and large fragments into two
753 * asymmetric partitions. The large fragment cache is significantly
754 * larger. Thus, we try to use large fragments wherever possible.
755 * Userspace can support this by aligning virtual base address and
756 * allocation size to the fragment size.
757 */
758
759 /* NI is optimized for 256KB fragments, SI and newer for 64KB */
760 uint64_t frag_flags = ((rdev->family == CHIP_CAYMAN) ||
761 (rdev->family == CHIP_ARUBA)) ?
762 R600_PTE_FRAG_256KB : R600_PTE_FRAG_64KB;
763 uint64_t frag_align = ((rdev->family == CHIP_CAYMAN) ||
764 (rdev->family == CHIP_ARUBA)) ? 0x200 : 0x80;
765
766#ifdef __NetBSD__ /* XXX ALIGN means something else */
767 uint64_t frag_start = round_up(pe_start, frag_align);
768#else
769 uint64_t frag_start = ALIGN(pe_start, frag_align);
770#endif
771 uint64_t frag_end = pe_end & ~(frag_align - 1);
772
773 unsigned count;
774
775 /* system pages are non continuously */
776 if ((flags & R600_PTE_SYSTEM) || !(flags & R600_PTE_VALID) ||
777 (frag_start >= frag_end)) {
778
779 count = (pe_end - pe_start) / 8;
780 radeon_vm_set_pages(rdev, ib, pe_start, addr, count,
781 RADEON_GPU_PAGE_SIZE, flags);
782 return;
783 }
784
785 /* handle the 4K area at the beginning */
786 if (pe_start != frag_start) {
787 count = (frag_start - pe_start) / 8;
788 radeon_vm_set_pages(rdev, ib, pe_start, addr, count,
789 RADEON_GPU_PAGE_SIZE, flags);
790 addr += RADEON_GPU_PAGE_SIZE * count;
791 }
792
793 /* handle the area in the middle */
794 count = (frag_end - frag_start) / 8;
795 radeon_vm_set_pages(rdev, ib, frag_start, addr, count,
796 RADEON_GPU_PAGE_SIZE, flags | frag_flags);
797
798 /* handle the 4K area at the end */
799 if (frag_end != pe_end) {
800 addr += RADEON_GPU_PAGE_SIZE * count;
801 count = (pe_end - frag_end) / 8;
802 radeon_vm_set_pages(rdev, ib, frag_end, addr, count,
803 RADEON_GPU_PAGE_SIZE, flags);
804 }
805}
806
807/**
808 * radeon_vm_update_ptes - make sure that page tables are valid
809 *
810 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
811 * @vm: requested vm
812 * @start: start of GPU address range
813 * @end: end of GPU address range
814 * @dst: destination address to map to
815 * @flags: mapping flags
816 *
817 * Update the page tables in the range @start - @end (cayman+).
818 *
819 * Global and local mutex must be locked!
820 */
821static int radeon_vm_update_ptes(struct radeon_device *rdev,
822 struct radeon_vm *vm,
823 struct radeon_ib *ib,
824 uint64_t start, uint64_t end,
825 uint64_t dst, uint32_t flags)
826{
827 uint64_t mask = RADEON_VM_PTE_COUNT - 1;
828 uint64_t last_pte = ~0, last_dst = ~0;
829 unsigned count = 0;
830 uint64_t addr;
831
832 /* walk over the address space and update the page tables */
833 for (addr = start; addr < end; ) {
834 uint64_t pt_idx = addr >> radeon_vm_block_size;
835 struct radeon_bo *pt = vm->page_tables[pt_idx].bo;
836 unsigned nptes;
837 uint64_t pte;
838 int r;
839
840 radeon_sync_resv(rdev, &ib->sync, pt->tbo.resv, true);
841 r = reservation_object_reserve_shared(pt->tbo.resv);
842 if (r)
843 return r;
844
845 if ((addr & ~mask) == (end & ~mask))
846 nptes = end - addr;
847 else
848 nptes = RADEON_VM_PTE_COUNT - (addr & mask);
849
850 pte = radeon_bo_gpu_offset(pt);
851 pte += (addr & mask) * 8;
852
853 if ((last_pte + 8 * count) != pte) {
854
855 if (count) {
856 radeon_vm_frag_ptes(rdev, ib, last_pte,
857 last_pte + 8 * count,
858 last_dst, flags);
859 }
860
861 count = nptes;
862 last_pte = pte;
863 last_dst = dst;
864 } else {
865 count += nptes;
866 }
867
868 addr += nptes;
869 dst += nptes * RADEON_GPU_PAGE_SIZE;
870 }
871
872 if (count) {
873 radeon_vm_frag_ptes(rdev, ib, last_pte,
874 last_pte + 8 * count,
875 last_dst, flags);
876 }
877
878 return 0;
879}
880
881/**
882 * radeon_vm_fence_pts - fence page tables after an update
883 *
884 * @vm: requested vm
885 * @start: start of GPU address range
886 * @end: end of GPU address range
887 * @fence: fence to use
888 *
889 * Fence the page tables in the range @start - @end (cayman+).
890 *
891 * Global and local mutex must be locked!
892 */
893static void radeon_vm_fence_pts(struct radeon_vm *vm,
894 uint64_t start, uint64_t end,
895 struct radeon_fence *fence)
896{
897 unsigned i;
898
899 start >>= radeon_vm_block_size;
900 end = (end - 1) >> radeon_vm_block_size;
901
902 for (i = start; i <= end; ++i)
903 radeon_bo_fence(vm->page_tables[i].bo, fence, true);
904}
905
906/**
907 * radeon_vm_bo_update - map a bo into the vm page table
908 *
909 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
910 * @vm: requested vm
911 * @bo: radeon buffer object
912 * @mem: ttm mem
913 *
914 * Fill in the page table entries for @bo (cayman+).
915 * Returns 0 for success, -EINVAL for failure.
916 *
917 * Object have to be reserved and mutex must be locked!
918 */
919int radeon_vm_bo_update(struct radeon_device *rdev,
920 struct radeon_bo_va *bo_va,
921 struct ttm_mem_reg *mem)
922{
923 struct radeon_vm *vm = bo_va->vm;
924 struct radeon_ib ib;
925 unsigned nptes, ncmds, ndw;
926 uint64_t addr;
927 uint32_t flags;
928 int r;
929
930 if (!bo_va->it.start) {
931 dev_err(rdev->dev, "bo %p don't has a mapping in vm %p\n",
932 bo_va->bo, vm);
933 return -EINVAL;
934 }
935
936 spin_lock(&vm->status_lock);
937 if (mem) {
938 if (list_empty(&bo_va->vm_status)) {
939 spin_unlock(&vm->status_lock);
940 return 0;
941 }
942 list_del_init(&bo_va->vm_status);
943 } else {
944 list_del(&bo_va->vm_status);
945 list_add(&bo_va->vm_status, &vm->cleared);
946 }
947 spin_unlock(&vm->status_lock);
948
949 bo_va->flags &= ~RADEON_VM_PAGE_VALID;
950 bo_va->flags &= ~RADEON_VM_PAGE_SYSTEM;
951 bo_va->flags &= ~RADEON_VM_PAGE_SNOOPED;
952 if (bo_va->bo && radeon_ttm_tt_is_readonly(bo_va->bo->tbo.ttm))
953 bo_va->flags &= ~RADEON_VM_PAGE_WRITEABLE;
954
955 if (mem) {
956 addr = mem->start << PAGE_SHIFT;
957 if (mem->mem_type != TTM_PL_SYSTEM) {
958 bo_va->flags |= RADEON_VM_PAGE_VALID;
959 }
960 if (mem->mem_type == TTM_PL_TT) {
961 bo_va->flags |= RADEON_VM_PAGE_SYSTEM;
962 if (!(bo_va->bo->flags & (RADEON_GEM_GTT_WC | RADEON_GEM_GTT_UC)))
963 bo_va->flags |= RADEON_VM_PAGE_SNOOPED;
964
965 } else {
966 addr += rdev->vm_manager.vram_base_offset;
967 }
968 } else {
969 addr = 0;
970 }
971
972 trace_radeon_vm_bo_update(bo_va);
973
974 nptes = bo_va->it.last - bo_va->it.start + 1;
975
976 /* reserve space for one command every (1 << BLOCK_SIZE) entries
977 or 2k dwords (whatever is smaller) */
978 ncmds = (nptes >> min(radeon_vm_block_size, 11)) + 1;
979
980 /* padding, etc. */
981 ndw = 64;
982
983 flags = radeon_vm_page_flags(bo_va->flags);
984 if ((flags & R600_PTE_GART_MASK) == R600_PTE_GART_MASK) {
985 /* only copy commands needed */
986 ndw += ncmds * 7;
987
988 } else if (flags & R600_PTE_SYSTEM) {
989 /* header for write data commands */
990 ndw += ncmds * 4;
991
992 /* body of write data command */
993 ndw += nptes * 2;
994
995 } else {
996 /* set page commands needed */
997 ndw += ncmds * 10;
998
999 /* two extra commands for begin/end of fragment */
1000 ndw += 2 * 10;
1001 }
1002
1003 /* update too big for an IB */
1004 if (ndw > 0xfffff)
1005 return -ENOMEM;
1006
1007 r = radeon_ib_get(rdev, R600_RING_TYPE_DMA_INDEX, &ib, NULL, ndw * 4);
1008 if (r)
1009 return r;
1010 ib.length_dw = 0;
1011
1012 if (!(bo_va->flags & RADEON_VM_PAGE_VALID)) {
1013 unsigned i;
1014
1015 for (i = 0; i < RADEON_NUM_RINGS; ++i)
1016 radeon_sync_fence(&ib.sync, vm->ids[i].last_id_use);
1017 }
1018
1019 r = radeon_vm_update_ptes(rdev, vm, &ib, bo_va->it.start,
1020 bo_va->it.last + 1, addr,
1021 radeon_vm_page_flags(bo_va->flags));
1022 if (r) {
1023 radeon_ib_free(rdev, &ib);
1024 return r;
1025 }
1026
1027 radeon_asic_vm_pad_ib(rdev, &ib);
1028 WARN_ON(ib.length_dw > ndw);
1029
1030 r = radeon_ib_schedule(rdev, &ib, NULL, false);
1031 if (r) {
1032 radeon_ib_free(rdev, &ib);
1033 return r;
1034 }
1035 ib.fence->is_vm_update = true;
1036 radeon_vm_fence_pts(vm, bo_va->it.start, bo_va->it.last + 1, ib.fence);
1037 radeon_fence_unref(&bo_va->last_pt_update);
1038 bo_va->last_pt_update = radeon_fence_ref(ib.fence);
1039 radeon_ib_free(rdev, &ib);
1040
1041 return 0;
1042}
1043
1044/**
1045 * radeon_vm_clear_freed - clear freed BOs in the PT
1046 *
1047 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
1048 * @vm: requested vm
1049 *
1050 * Make sure all freed BOs are cleared in the PT.
1051 * Returns 0 for success.
1052 *
1053 * PTs have to be reserved and mutex must be locked!
1054 */
1055int radeon_vm_clear_freed(struct radeon_device *rdev,
1056 struct radeon_vm *vm)
1057{
1058 struct radeon_bo_va *bo_va;
1059 int r = 0;
1060
1061 spin_lock(&vm->status_lock);
1062 while (!list_empty(&vm->freed)) {
1063 bo_va = list_first_entry(&vm->freed,
1064 struct radeon_bo_va, vm_status);
1065 spin_unlock(&vm->status_lock);
1066
1067 r = radeon_vm_bo_update(rdev, bo_va, NULL);
1068 radeon_bo_unref(&bo_va->bo);
1069 radeon_fence_unref(&bo_va->last_pt_update);
1070 spin_lock(&vm->status_lock);
1071 list_del(&bo_va->vm_status);
1072 kfree(bo_va);
1073 if (r)
1074 break;
1075
1076 }
1077 spin_unlock(&vm->status_lock);
1078 return r;
1079
1080}
1081
1082/**
1083 * radeon_vm_clear_invalids - clear invalidated BOs in the PT
1084 *
1085 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
1086 * @vm: requested vm
1087 *
1088 * Make sure all invalidated BOs are cleared in the PT.
1089 * Returns 0 for success.
1090 *
1091 * PTs have to be reserved and mutex must be locked!
1092 */
1093int radeon_vm_clear_invalids(struct radeon_device *rdev,
1094 struct radeon_vm *vm)
1095{
1096 struct radeon_bo_va *bo_va;
1097 int r;
1098
1099 spin_lock(&vm->status_lock);
1100 while (!list_empty(&vm->invalidated)) {
1101 bo_va = list_first_entry(&vm->invalidated,
1102 struct radeon_bo_va, vm_status);
1103 spin_unlock(&vm->status_lock);
1104
1105 r = radeon_vm_bo_update(rdev, bo_va, NULL);
1106 if (r)
1107 return r;
1108
1109 spin_lock(&vm->status_lock);
1110 }
1111 spin_unlock(&vm->status_lock);
1112
1113 return 0;
1114}
1115
1116/**
1117 * radeon_vm_bo_rmv - remove a bo to a specific vm
1118 *
1119 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
1120 * @bo_va: requested bo_va
1121 *
1122 * Remove @bo_va->bo from the requested vm (cayman+).
1123 *
1124 * Object have to be reserved!
1125 */
1126void radeon_vm_bo_rmv(struct radeon_device *rdev,
1127 struct radeon_bo_va *bo_va)
1128{
1129 struct radeon_vm *vm = bo_va->vm;
1130
1131 list_del(&bo_va->bo_list);
1132
1133 mutex_lock(&vm->mutex);
1134 if (bo_va->it.start || bo_va->it.last)
1135 interval_tree_remove(&bo_va->it, &vm->va);
1136
1137 spin_lock(&vm->status_lock);
1138 list_del(&bo_va->vm_status);
1139 if (bo_va->it.start || bo_va->it.last) {
1140 bo_va->bo = radeon_bo_ref(bo_va->bo);
1141 list_add(&bo_va->vm_status, &vm->freed);
1142 } else {
1143 radeon_fence_unref(&bo_va->last_pt_update);
1144 kfree(bo_va);
1145 }
1146 spin_unlock(&vm->status_lock);
1147
1148 mutex_unlock(&vm->mutex);
1149}
1150
1151/**
1152 * radeon_vm_bo_invalidate - mark the bo as invalid
1153 *
1154 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
1155 * @vm: requested vm
1156 * @bo: radeon buffer object
1157 *
1158 * Mark @bo as invalid (cayman+).
1159 */
1160void radeon_vm_bo_invalidate(struct radeon_device *rdev,
1161 struct radeon_bo *bo)
1162{
1163 struct radeon_bo_va *bo_va;
1164
1165 list_for_each_entry(bo_va, &bo->va, bo_list) {
1166 spin_lock(&bo_va->vm->status_lock);
1167 if (list_empty(&bo_va->vm_status) &&
1168 (bo_va->it.start || bo_va->it.last))
1169 list_add(&bo_va->vm_status, &bo_va->vm->invalidated);
1170 spin_unlock(&bo_va->vm->status_lock);
1171 }
1172}
1173
1174/**
1175 * radeon_vm_init - initialize a vm instance
1176 *
1177 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
1178 * @vm: requested vm
1179 *
1180 * Init @vm fields (cayman+).
1181 */
1182int radeon_vm_init(struct radeon_device *rdev, struct radeon_vm *vm)
1183{
1184 const unsigned align = min(RADEON_VM_PTB_ALIGN_SIZE,
1185 RADEON_VM_PTE_COUNT * 8);
1186 unsigned pd_size, pd_entries, pts_size;
1187 int i, r;
1188
1189 vm->ib_bo_va = NULL;
1190 for (i = 0; i < RADEON_NUM_RINGS; ++i) {
1191 vm->ids[i].id = 0;
1192 vm->ids[i].flushed_updates = NULL;
1193 vm->ids[i].last_id_use = NULL;
1194 }
1195#ifdef __NetBSD__
1196 linux_mutex_init(&vm->mutex);
1197#else
1198 mutex_init(&vm->mutex);
1199#endif
1200#ifdef __NetBSD__
1201 interval_tree_init(&vm->va);
1202#else
1203 vm->va = RB_ROOT;
1204#endif
1205 spin_lock_init(&vm->status_lock);
1206 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&vm->invalidated);
1207 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&vm->freed);
1208 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&vm->cleared);
1209
1210 pd_size = radeon_vm_directory_size(rdev);
1211 pd_entries = radeon_vm_num_pdes(rdev);
1212
1213 /* allocate page table array */
1214 pts_size = pd_entries * sizeof(struct radeon_vm_pt);
1215 vm->page_tables = kzalloc(pts_size, GFP_KERNEL);
1216 if (vm->page_tables == NULL) {
1217 DRM_ERROR("Cannot allocate memory for page table array\n");
1218 return -ENOMEM;
1219 }
1220
1221 r = radeon_bo_create(rdev, pd_size, align, true,
1222 RADEON_GEM_DOMAIN_VRAM, 0, NULL,
1223 NULL, &vm->page_directory);
1224 if (r)
1225 return r;
1226
1227 r = radeon_vm_clear_bo(rdev, vm->page_directory);
1228 if (r) {
1229 radeon_bo_unref(&vm->page_directory);
1230 vm->page_directory = NULL;
1231 return r;
1232 }
1233
1234 return 0;
1235}
1236
1237/**
1238 * radeon_vm_fini - tear down a vm instance
1239 *
1240 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
1241 * @vm: requested vm
1242 *
1243 * Tear down @vm (cayman+).
1244 * Unbind the VM and remove all bos from the vm bo list
1245 */
1246void radeon_vm_fini(struct radeon_device *rdev, struct radeon_vm *vm)
1247{
1248 struct radeon_bo_va *bo_va, *tmp;
1249 int i, r;
1250
1251 if (!RB_EMPTY_ROOT(&vm->va)) {
1252 dev_err(rdev->dev, "still active bo inside vm\n");
1253 }
1254 rbtree_postorder_for_each_entry_safe(bo_va, tmp, &vm->va, it.rb) {
1255 interval_tree_remove(&bo_va->it, &vm->va);
1256 r = radeon_bo_reserve(bo_va->bo, false);
1257 if (!r) {
1258 list_del_init(&bo_va->bo_list);
1259 radeon_bo_unreserve(bo_va->bo);
1260 radeon_fence_unref(&bo_va->last_pt_update);
1261 kfree(bo_va);
1262 }
1263 }
1264 list_for_each_entry_safe(bo_va, tmp, &vm->freed, vm_status) {
1265 radeon_bo_unref(&bo_va->bo);
1266 radeon_fence_unref(&bo_va->last_pt_update);
1267 kfree(bo_va);
1268 }
1269
1270 for (i = 0; i < radeon_vm_num_pdes(rdev); i++)
1271 radeon_bo_unref(&vm->page_tables[i].bo);
1272 kfree(vm->page_tables);
1273
1274 radeon_bo_unref(&vm->page_directory);
1275
1276 for (i = 0; i < RADEON_NUM_RINGS; ++i) {
1277 radeon_fence_unref(&vm->ids[i].flushed_updates);
1278 radeon_fence_unref(&vm->ids[i].last_id_use);
1279 }
1280
1281#ifdef __NetBSD__
1282 spin_lock_destroy(&vm->status_lock);
1283 linux_mutex_destroy(&vm->mutex);
1284#else
1285 mutex_destroy(&vm->mutex);
1286#endif
1287}
